explanation: Given the provided definitions, LFS_LOCK(cfg) expands to ((void)cfg, 0). Therefore in lfs_dir_rewind the initialization int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg); always yields the constant value 0. The subsequent if (err) { return err; } can never evaluate true, so that return statement (and its branch) is provably unreachable in this project configuration. MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 forbids unreachable code in the project, so the report that this code violates Rule 2.1 is correct. (If LFS_LOCK can be defined differently in other build configurations, the reachability would depend on the project-wide configuration; but with the definitions shown, the branch is unreachable and thus violates Rule 2.1.)
